info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 6:46AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
At 645 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Doolittle, or near Faysville, moving southeast at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Edinburg Regional Medical Center, T. George Gutierrez Jr. Middle School, Jose Borrego Middle School, P S J A North High School, Adams Gardens, Weslaco Mid Valley Airport, Harlingen City Reservoir, Palm Valley, Mckelvey Park, and Hunter Park.
This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 23 and 43. Interstate Highway 69 C between mile markers 2 and 12. US Highway 281 between mile markers 808 and 820.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for Deep South Texas.
